Blog.post: Love it! urlLink Fairvue Central >> Features >> Fourth Annual Weblog Awards
TEST - I have just sighed up for this fabulous new tool called Blogger. A friend of mine uses the utility and I think that it will be a great tool to play with. This is my first entry.

Diet - I started the Atkins diet after my doctor advised me to loose some wieght. I am now looking for a way to cronicle all my diet and workout info. the following site looked interesting. I may use some ideas from it. urlLink Mike Thomas v7.0: Training Log 2000
This is a good resource for Heart Rate: urlLink Sports Coach - Heart Rate Training Zones
This is a hoot! urlLink LILEKS (James) Gallery of Regrettable Food 3.0 : Knudsen's

The Marriage Equality Bill was approved be the California Assembly. Follow the link to read the bill. urlLink AB 1967 Assembly Bill - INTRODUCED AB 1967 must now pass the Appropriations Committee before going to the full Assembly for a vote.

-----Original Message----- From: Mary Shoemaker Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 2004 5:58 PM To: Deno Marcum Subject: FW: Recipies for breakfast Here is the creme brulee french toast recipe. It was FABULOUS!!!! And the fritata was good, as well. -----Original Message----- From: C. Bonney [mailto:cgbonney@yahoo.com] Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 2004 9:45 PM To: mary shoemaker Subject: Recipies for breakfast Creme Brule' French Toast one stick butter 1 and 1/2 cup loose (not packed) brown sugar two Tb corn syrup 1 loaf Challah Bread (pan, not twisted or round) 7 eggs 1 and 1/2 cup 1/2 and 1/2 1 tsp vanilla 1 and 1/2 Tb Grand Marnier melt butter, brown sugar and corn syrup in a sauce pan until very smooth (do not burn). cut all of the crust off of the Challah bread. cut remaining loaf in 1 inch thick vertical pieces (at least 7 per loaf). whisk eggs, cream, vanilla and Grand Marnier until completely blended. pour brown sugar "topping" into glass brownie pan. lay slices of Challah bread flat down into the "topping" to completely cover the bottom of the pan (six slices). Use remaining slice to fill in the blank spots and squeeze the bread so that it is snug in the pan. slowly pour the eggs mixture over the bread waiting for the egg to be absorbed. cover and refrigerate 8 to 24 hours. remove from refrigerator and let stand until nearly room temperature. back at 350 degrees for approx. 30 mins until golden brown and firm to the touch. cut and serve upside-down so that brown sugar is on the top. garnish with orange zest or raspberry puree. Enjoy!!! makes 8 to 10 servings Vegetable Fritada 10 eggs 1 and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese grated 1/2 red pepper 1/3 yellow pepper 1 medium tomato 3 cloves garlic 1 medium onion 1/2 cup half and half 1 tsp fresh basil 1 tsp fresh cilantro 1 tsp fresh oregano 1 cup cheddar cheese 1 large carrot 1 tsp salt 1 tsp pepper Whisk eggs, cream followed by all other ingredients (except cheddar cheese). Let stand in fridge overnight or two to blend flavors. Grease a cookie sheet. Pour in blended ingredients and top with 1/2 fresh cut tomato and 1/2 fresh cut yellow pepper and scatter over mixture. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over entire pan evenly. Bake in 350 oven for 20 to 30 minutes until edges are golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut in to triangles and serve with garnish of fresh herbs and diced yellow peppers or diced tomatoes or cluster of feta cheese. Serves 12 ===== Innkeeper(s) Inn at Horn Point Annapolis, MD www.innathornpoint.com __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!? Yahoo! Mail - You care about security. So do we. http://promotions.yahoo.com/new_mail
